intro: Sarcoglyphis fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed sarcoglyphis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its delicate, lance-shaped leaves.
